DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Biospecimen Necrotic Process Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indication as to the percentage of necrosis found in a specimen/sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Biospecimen Necrotic Process Percentage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A cell death process that is morphologically characterized by a gain in cell volume (oncosis), swelling of organelles, plasma membrane rupture and subsequent loss of intracellular contents._A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Concepts.definition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:A cell death process that is morphologically characterized by a gain in cell volume (oncosis), swelling of organelles, plasma membrane rupture and subsequent loss of intracellular contents.:A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
A cell death process that is morphologically characterized by a gain in cell volume (oncosis), swelling of organelles, plasma membrane rupture and subsequent loss of intracellular contents.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
